Package aima.gui.swing.framework.util

Class GuiBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • aima.gui.swing.framework.util.GuiBase
  • public class GuiBase
extends java.lang.Object
    This class manages the look and feel for the whole application.
    activateSystemStyle() and setUIColors() should be called as soon as possible to prevent different looks in any part of the GUI which's construction may be missed otherwise. These functions only have to be called once.
    Author:
    Arno von Borries, Jan Phillip Kretzschmar, Andreas Walscheid

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static void activateSystemStyle()
      Tries to activate the system default look and feel.
      static java.awt.Color getAreaColor()
      Returns the Color that can be used as a secondary color in connection with the background color.
      static java.awt.Color getBackgroundColor()
      Returns the Color that should be used as a background color.
      static int getClearance()
      Returns the clearance that has to be used between any graphical elements to maintain a uniform look and feel.
      static javax.swing.border.Border getClearanceBorder()
      Returns a Border that can be used to maintain a uniform clearance between any graphical elements.
      static java.awt.Component getClearanceComp()
      Returns a invisible Component that can be used to maintain a uniform clearance between any graphical elements.
      static java.text.DecimalFormat getFormat()
      Returns the DecimalFormat that should be used to format all numbers that will be displayed to the user.
      static java.awt.Color getTextColor()
      Returns the Color that should be used as a foreground color on the provided background color.
      static void hideMessageBox()
      Hides the message box.
      static void initMessageBox()
      Initializes the dialog for the message box.
      static void setUIColors()
      Sets the default background and foreground colors for all elements of the application to provide a uniform look and feel.
      static void showMessageBox​(java.lang.String message)
      Shows a message box with a OK button without blocking.
      static void showMessageBox​(java.lang.String message, boolean buttonVisible)
      Show a message box without blocking.
      static void showOKButtonMessageBox()
      Enables the OK button of the message box.
